sections.heading: What is Passive Form?
sections.content:
Passive form (受身形) expresses actions received by the subject. In Japanese, passive often implies being affected or suffering from an action.

食べられる (taberareru) - be eaten 書かれる (kakareru) - be written される (sareru) - be done

children.heading: 1. Direct Passive (Like English)
children.content: ドアが開けられた "The door was opened" 本が読まれた "The book was read"

children.heading: 2. Suffering/Adversative Passive (Unique to Japanese)
children.content: 雨に降られた "I was rained on" (I suffered from rain) 先生に叱られた "I was scolded by the teacher" (I suffered being scolded)

children.heading: Ichidan Verbs
children.content:
Drop る , add られる :

食べる → 食べられる (be eaten) 見る → 見られる (be seen) 褒める → 褒められる (be praised)

Same as potential form! Context determines meaning.

children.heading: Godan Verbs
children.content:
Change -u to -areru :

書く → 書かれる (kaku → kakareru) kak-u → kak-areru 読む → 読まれる (yomu → yomareru) yom-u → yom-areru 話す → 話される (hanasu → hanasareru) hanas-u → hanas-areru 買う → 買われる (kau → kawareru) ka-u → ka-wareru 待つ → 待たれる (matsu → matareru) mat-u → mat-areru 遊ぶ → 遊ばれる (asobu → asobareru) asob-u → asob-areru 帰る → 帰られる (kaeru → kaerareru) kaer-u → kaer-areru 泳ぐ → 泳がれる (oyogu → oyogareru) oyog-u → oyog-areru

children.heading: Irregular Verbs
children.content: する → される (be done) 来る → 来られる (be come / someone comes)

sections.heading: Complete Conjugation Chart
sections.content: | Dictionary | Group | Passive | Meaning | | ---------- | --------- | ---------- | ---------- | | 書く | Godan | 書かれる | be written | | 読む | Godan | 読まれる | be read | | 話す | Godan | 話される | be spoken | | 食べる | Ichidan | 食べられる | be eaten | | 見る | Ichidan | 見られる | be seen | | する | Irregular | される | be done | | 来る | Irregular | 来られる | be come to |

children.heading: Actor Marked by に
children.content: 私は先生に叱られた "I was scolded by the teacher" 猫に魚を食べられた "I had my fish eaten by a cat" (suffered) 雨に降られた "I was rained on" (suffered)

children.heading: Direct Object Stays を
children.content: この本は多くの人に読まれている "This book is read by many people" その建物は去年建てられた "That building was built last year"

sections.heading: Direct Passive
sections.content:
Similar to English passive:

この小説は夏目漱石に書かれた "This novel was written by Natsume Soseki" 新しい法律が作られた "A new law was created" 彼は皆に愛されている "He is loved by everyone" 日本語は世界中で話されている "Japanese is spoken around the world"

sections.heading: Suffering/Adversative Passive
sections.content:
Unique to Japanese: Expresses being negatively affected:

財布を盗まれた "I had my wallet stolen" (suffered theft) 弟に部屋を散らかされた "I had my room messed up by my little brother" 雨に降られた "I got rained on" 隣の人にタバコを吸われた "Someone next to me smoked" (I suffered from it) 犬に吠えられた "I was barked at by a dog" 友達に秘密を言われた "My friend told my secret" (I suffered)

This pattern doesn't exist in English!

children.heading: 1. Unknown/Unimportant Actor
children.content: 窓が割られた "The window was broken" (who did it doesn't matter) 財布が見つかった "The wallet was found"

children.heading: 2. Formal/Written Language
children.content: 会議が開かれた "A meeting was held" 新製品が発表された "A new product was announced"

children.heading: 3. Expressing Being Affected
children.content: 先生に褒められた "I was praised by the teacher" (felt good) 母に叱られた "I was scolded by my mother" (felt bad)

children.heading: 4. Respectful Language
children.content: 社長が来られた "The president came" (respectful) 先生が言われた "The teacher said" (respectful)

sections.heading: Polite Forms
sections.content:
Passive conjugates like Ichidan verbs:

書かれる → 書かれます (polite) 食べられる → 食べられます (polite) される → されます (polite)

children.heading: Negative
children.content: 書かれない (not written) 食べられない (not eaten) されない (not done)

children.heading: Past
children.content: 書かれた (was written) 食べられた (was eaten) された (was done)

children.heading: Being Praised/Scolded
children.content: 先生に褒められた "I was praised by the teacher" 親に叱られた "I was scolded by my parents" 上司に怒られた "I was yelled at by my boss"

children.heading: Things Stolen/Lost
children.content: 自転車を盗まれた "I had my bicycle stolen" お金を取られた "I had my money taken" 携帯をなくされた "My phone was lost"

children.heading: Weather/Nature
children.content: 雨に降られた "I got rained on" 蚊に刺された "I was bitten by a mosquito" 犬に噛まれた "I was bitten by a dog"

sections.heading: Passive vs Potential (Ichidan)
sections.content:
Same form, different meaning!

Context determines: 食べられる → "can eat" (potential) → "be eaten" (passive) 見られる → "can see" (potential) → "be seen" (passive) Example: 寿司が食べられる "I can eat sushi" (potential - が particle) 魚が猫に食べられた "The fish was eaten by the cat" (passive - に particle)

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using Passive When Active Is Better
children.content:
Awkward: 私は友達に会われた ❌ Natural: 私は友達に会った ✓ "I met my friend" Awkward: 私はご飯を食べられた ❌ Natural: 私はご飯を食べた ✓ "I ate rice"

Use passive only when being affected!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Wrong Particle
children.content: Wrong: 先生を叱られた ❌ Right: 先生に叱られた ✓ "I was scolded by the teacher"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Overusing Passive
children.content:
Japanese uses passive less than English in many cases:

English: "It is said that..." Awkward: 言われている Natural: と言われている ✓ English: "It is known that..." Awkward: 知られている Natural: 知られている ✓ (this one is OK)

children.heading: Mistake 4: Confusing with Potential
children.content: この本が読まれる "This book is read" (passive) この本が読める "I can read this book" (potential)

sections.heading: Respectful Passive
sections.content:
Passive can express respect:

先生が来られました "The teacher came" (respectful) 社長が言われました "The president said" (respectful) お客様が帰られました "The customer left" (respectful)

Note: This is different from honorific verbs!

sections.heading: Passive in News/Formal Writing
sections.content: 新しい法律が可決された "A new law was passed" 容疑者が逮捕された "The suspect was arrested" 会議が開催された "The conference was held" 商品が販売された "The product was sold" 記事が掲載された "The article was published"

sections.heading: Intransitive Verbs with Passive
sections.content:
Even intransitive verbs can be passive (suffering):

雨に降られた "I was rained on" 彼に泣かれた "He cried on me" (I was troubled by his crying) 隣の人に騒がれた "The neighbor made noise" (I suffered from it) 子供に逃げられた "The child ran away from me" (I suffered)

children.heading: Example 1: Bad Day
children.content: A: どうしたの？元気ないね "What's wrong? You don't look well" B: 最悪の日だった。財布を盗まれたし、 雨に降られたし、上司に叱られた "It was the worst day. I had my wallet stolen, got rained on, and was scolded by my boss" A: 大変だったね "That's terrible"

children.heading: Example 2: Good News
children.content: A: いいことあった？ "Did something good happen?" B: うん！先生に褒められた "Yeah! I was praised by the teacher" A: すごいじゃん！何で？ "That's great! For what?" B: テストで100点取ったから "Because I got 100 on the test"

sections.heading: Passive with て-form
sections.content: 財布を盗まれて困った "I had my wallet stolen and was troubled" 雨に降られて風邪をひいた "I got rained on and caught a cold" 先生に褒められて嬉しかった "I was praised by the teacher and was happy"

sections.heading: Key Differences: Japanese vs English Passive
sections.content: | English | Japanese | | ------------------- | -------------------------- | | Emphasizes action | Emphasizes being affected | | Neutral tone | Often implies suffering | | Less emotional | More emotional | | "The book was read" | この本が読まれた (neutral) | | No equivalent | 雨に降られた (suffering) |

children.heading: Direct Passive
children.content: 本が読まれる - book is read 法律が作られる - law is made

children.heading: Suffering Passive
children.content: 財布を盗まれる - have wallet stolen 雨に降られる - get rained on

children.heading: Respectful Passive
children.content: 先生が来られる - teacher comes (respectful) 社長が言われる - president says (respectful)

sections.heading: Key Takeaways
sections.content:
✓ Passive = action received by subject ✓ Godan: -u → -areru ✓ Ichidan: -ru → -rareru ✓ Two types: direct and suffering ✓ Suffering passive unique to Japanese ✓ Actor marked by に ✓ Same form as potential (Ichidan) ✓ Use less than English passive ✓ Can express respect

Master passive form - essential for advanced expression!
